programme.title: Myrtle Beach Bowl
programme.desc: Texas-San Antonio (6-6) vs. Coastal Carolina (6-6) in the fifth Myrtle Beach Bowl. From Brooks Stadium in Conway, S.C. Both of these teams are bowling for a fifth straight season, with coach Tim Becks Chanticleers enjoying the home (teal) turf advantage vs. a UTSA squad that is 0-6 away from home. Coastal DB Matthew McDoom was all-Sun Belt, while the Miners had two on all-AAC first-team defense in LB Jimmori Robinson and DB Zah Frazier.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Scott Van Pelt hosts a comprehensive preview of the NFLs weekly finale, featuring studio analysis and on-site reports, plus a weekend recap. Ryan Clark, Marcus Spears, Jason Kelce, reporter Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck round out the cast.

programme.title: Monday Night Kickoff
programme.desc: Previewing the upcoming Monday Night Football game, with on-field interviews.

programme.title: Monday Night Football
programme.Sub-title: New Orleans Saints at Green Bay Packers
programme.desc: New Orleans Saints (5-9) at Green Bay Packers (10-4). From Lambeau Field. Packers workhorse RB Josh Jacobs has 12 TDs in his last eight games after finding the end zone just once in the first six, giving Jordan Love a go-to weapon against the pourous 30th-ranked (376 ypg) New Orleans defense. The Saints enter Lambeaus "Frozen Tundra" having won their last three games played in sub-freezing temps.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: Interviews and analysis wrapping up Monday Night Football coverage.

E60
programme.Sub-title: Second Wind: The Boomer and Gunnar Esiason Story
programme.desc: An updated look at Boomer Esiason and his son Gunnar, and the familys journey in the fight against cystic fibrosis. The Boomer Esiason Foundation launched in 1993 has raised more than $175 million to support research. Jeremy Schaaps 2007 report on the story is revisited with new interviews featured with medical personnel, the Esiason family, fellow NFL alumni, and a pro lacrosse athlete with CF.

programme.title: Hawaii Bowl
programme.Sub-title: South Florida vs. San Jose State
programme.desc: South Florida (6-6) vs. San Jose State (7-5) in the 21st Hawaii Bowl. From Clarence T.C. Ching Athletics Complex in Honolulu. First-year coach Ken Niumatalolos Spartans make a second straight trip to this game, bidding for their first bowl win in nine years. Justin Lockhart heads the WR corps as record-setting senior Nick Nash opts out. Tackle Decarius Hawthorne heads the defense for USF, which improved to 7-4 in bowls with last years win in Boca Raton.

programme.title: Famous Idaho Potato Bowl
programme.desc: Northern Illinois (7-5) vs. Fresno State (6-6) in the 28th Famous Idaho Potato Bowl. From Albertsons Stadium in Boise, Idaho. NIU looks to cap off a season forever marked by a September upset of Notre Dame, with lineman Devonte OMalley and DB Nate Valcarcel heading a stellar Huskies defense. The Bulldogs are riding a five-game bowl win streak following six straight losses that included a 2010 loss in this game to NIU.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Teofimo Lopez prepares for a career-defining clash against reigning WBO junior welterweight world champion Josh Taylor. Following several subpar outings, including losing his lightweight crown to George Kambosos Jr., the Top Rank brass question if the mercurial Lopez still has what it takes. Once considered the future of boxing, Lopez has one last shot to prove hes still one of the sports most sublime talents.

programme.title: Monster Milestones: Naoya Inoue
programme.desc: Profiling undefeated Japanese boxer and four-division champion Naoya "The Monster" Inoue.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Many experts consider Naoya "Monster" Inoue to be the worlds best pound-for-pound boxer, and to Top Rank executives whove been in the business for decades, one of the best fighters theyve ever seen. But for many Western fans, the undefeated Japanese star is the greatest fighter youve never heard of. The undisputed junior featherweight champion can make a global statement when he faces Japanese boxings most reviled figure, Luis Nery, in front of a sold-out crowd at the Tokyo Dome.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the successful yet stormy relationship between Giants coaches Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick. As head coach and defensive coordinator, the pair won two Super Bowls before moving to the Patriots and Jets. Interviews include Lawrence Taylor.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A look back at the 1985 Chicago Bears, a team built on ferocious defense, with big personalities who shuffled to a Super Bowl title. programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Jasper, Alabama, was, for the longest time, a coal mining town. Father-and-son stories from the Johnson and Evans families help the crew see what has changed and what has remained. Across town at Bayou Fresh Seafood, Zhu Jianjun and his crew serve spicy tuna rolls and fried pickles.

programme.title: Classic Boxing
programme.desc: From 1971: Muhammad Ali vs. Joe Frazier in the first of their three epic meetings. Frazier won a 15-round decision after knocking down Ali in the final round. It was Alis first professional loss.

programme.title: Classic Boxing
programme.desc: From 1974: Muhammad Ali vs. Joe Frazier in a heavyweight bout in New York. Ali won the second bout between the archrivals by taking a 12-round unanimous decision.

programme.title: Classic Boxing
programme.desc: From 1975: Muhammad Ali vs. Joe Frazier in their third meeting, the "Thrilla in Manila." Ali won the brutal battle via TKO when trainer Eddie Futch didnt allow Frazier to come out for the 15th round.

programme.title: Dexter: Original Sin
programme.desc: Young Dexter Morgan struggles to keep his urges in check while navigating life with his father, Harry, and sister, high-school senior Deb. After Harry has a health scare, Dexter realizes it may finally be time to fulfill his destiny. Series premiere.

programme.desc: This drama is based on the true story of Sir Nicholas Winton and his heroic deeds during World War II. As a young British broker, he traveled to Prague in 1938, three months after the war broke out. He found destitute Jews who fled Nazi persecution in Austria and Germany. Families were willing to send their children away before the borders closed. Nicholas helps them ship the children out. But in his older years, he is haunted by the thought that he didnt do enough to help more children.

programme.desc: Detectives search for a missing teenage girl who vanished while looking for her biological father, an anonymous sperm donor. A puzzling prime suspect whos targeted several young women soon emerges.

programme.desc: The search for an abducted woman and her young daughter leads Benson to cross paths with an old friend. Meanwhile, Stone must make a tough decision on behalf of his sister.

programme.desc: The detectives tell Internal Affairs representatives what occurred during the search for a police officers runaway teenage daughter.

programme.title: Law and Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law and Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: After a paediatrician is found guilty of molesting his patients, he sues the New York Police Department and a medical centre, claiming they hesitated to take legal action. When he turns up dead, Stabler and Benson are surprised to see Alex Cabot at the scene.

programme.title: Law and Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Family vengeance factors into a rape case in which both the cops and the suspect seek outside help: Assistant District Attorney Casey Novak returns to help police, while the accused man recruits his cousin, Los Angeles Deputy District Attorney Jonah Dekker, to defend him.

The holidays are naughty and nice for the first responders, who must deal with a stampede at a toy store, a mistletoe stunt gone awry and neighbors competing in a Christmas-light showdown. Meanwhile, Bobby contemplates his future with Athena, Chimney and Buck attempt to lift Maddies spirits and Eddie must decide if he wants to give his son what he really wants for Christmas?a visit with his mom.

Bobby meets Athenas parents for the first time and Maddie attempts to end her marriage for good, causing Doug to insinuate himself even deeper into Chimneys life. Meanwhile, a tanker carrying a tiger shark crashes on the freeway and a gas leak in a plastic surgeons office happens mid-surgery.
A look back at how Chimney joined Station 118 and became the firefighter and paramedic he is today.
The First Responders rally together to search for a missing Maddie.

The 118 responds to holiday-themed incidents, including a shopper pushed over the edge, a woman who is literally having a "Blue Christmas" and a luggage handler accident on a tarmac. Meanwhile, Maddie revisits her past to embrace her future and Bobby receives shocking news.

In the aftermath of the dam break, massive mudslides wreak havoc throughout Los Angeles. As Athena fights to save herself and an agoraphobic woman after her house collapses, Bobby, Hen and Eddie rush to save hikers endangered by the falling of the Hollywood sign. Meanwhile, Buck and Chimney must rescue a group of pregnant women trapped in a submerged house.

Athena and the 118 race to save lives after a drunk driver causes a deadly pile-up on the freeway. Meanwhile, Maddie goes into labor and Hen and Karen are devastated as they prepare their foster daughter, Nia, to be reunited with her birth mother.

The 118 responds to a series of calls dealing with parents and their children, including a disastrous birthday party thrown by a mommy blogger. Meanwhile, Athena and Michael talk to May about her past suicide attempt, Chimney and Maddie adjust to life with their newborn, and Hen and Karen are emotionally shattered as their foster daughter, Nia, is reunited with her birth mother.
Chimney is determined to find a missing Maddie amongst the chaos of St. Patricks Day.

After a mysterious death, Hen and Chimney put their lives in danger when they suspect that someone is playing God to make themselves look like a hero. Meanwhile, Eddie visits Texas, where he attempts to reconcile with his father.
The members of the 118 race to rescue a cliffside wellness retreat guru after his followers turn on him.

The 118 race to the rescue when a fire breaks out in an accountants office and a car crashes into a "living funeral." Meanwhile, Athena is shocked when a suspect dies in her custody minutes after she arrests him, Buck is attracted to a death doula, and Maddie and Chimney panic when they are audited by the IRS.

The 118 race to rescue two roommates desperately trying to find a needle in a haystack at a landfill, and help a woman whose nightmare dream suddenly becomes a painful reality. Athena and Maddie team-up to find a missing boy in a crowded mall; Chimney debates if the time is right to propose to Maddie.

Athena and the 118 race to rescue when a wedding proposal tragically intersects with a bank robbery, and then when a princess bride is literally stuck on her way to the altar. Athena talks a victim thru her grief; Maddie takes matters into her own hands as Buck finds a surprise visitor on his doorstep.

programme.title: Live: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota returns to the NBA's Christmas Day lineup with this visit to play Dallas. The Timberwolves last played on Dec. 25 in 2017, when they beat the Lakers to improve to 1-1. Dallas is 4-3 on Christmas after a 128-114 win over Phoenix last year.

programme.title: Live: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Suns and Nuggets complete the festivities in Arizona. The two sides met on Christmas Day in 2022, with Denver pulling out a 128-125 overtime victory. Three-time MVP Nikola Jokic decked the halls with a monster 41-point, 15-assist triple-double.

programme.desc: The Sooners draw the Midshipmen in the Armed Forces Bowl. Oklahoma competes in a bowl game for the 26th consecutive season. Navy seeks its first postseason win since 2019. The Midshipmen beat the Sooners 10-0 in their only previous meeting in 1965.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: Birmingham Bowl: Georgia Tech vs. Vanderbilt
programme.desc: The Yellow Jackets (7-5) and Commodores (6-6) clash in the Birmingham Bowl. Vanderbilt's strongest SEC campaign since 2018 included a 40-35 upset of then-No. 1 Alabama. Georgia Tech won the 2023 Gasparilla Bowl, and is 3-1 in the playoffs since 2014.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.sub-title: AutoZone Liberty Bowl: Texas Tech vs. Arkansas
programme.desc: The Red Raiders and Razorbacks renew a rivalry in the Liberty Bowl. Texas Tech looks to cap a fourth straight season by winning a bowl game. Tahj Brooks became the Raiders' all-time leading rusher in November. The schools met 35 times from 1957-1991.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.sub-title: SRS Distribution Las Vegas Bowl: USC vs. Texas A&M
programme.desc: The disappointed Aggies (8-4) roll the dice with the Trojans (6-6) in the Las Vegas Bowl. USC won the last meeting, 47-28 in the 1977 Bluebonnet Bowl. Texas A&M missed a chance to play in the SEC title game with a 17-7 loss to Texas on Nov. 30.
